Description: The Examinations Committee (to be renamed the Examinations Institute in 1984), begins as a project of the Division of Chemical Education.
The first ACS Exam, with a focus on General Chemistry, is released by the Examinations Committee.
President Franklin D. Roosevelt signs Public Act No. 358, officially granting ACS a federal charter.
Source(s): President Franklin D. Roosevelt signed Public Act No. 358, granting ACS a federal charter; https://www.govinfo.gov/content/pkg/STATUTE-84/pdf/STATUTE-84-Pg473.pdf ; https://pubs.acs.org/doi/10.1021/cen-v015n017.p377#:~:text=score%20is%20calculated.-,Abstract,expressed%20or%20implied%20powers%20...

Description: ACS formally accepts its federal charter.
Source(s): "The American Chemical Society at 125: A Recent History, 1976-2001" page 2
